title: Collisions - changes in K and p

content.description: Two identical carts <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are on a horizontal surface with negligible friction. Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> approaches Cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, which is initially at rest. Attached to Cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is a spring that is initially compressed, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math>. At the instant Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> collides with Cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, the spring is released, and the carts move away from each other, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
content.question:
